I would ask for a room on the 2nd floor next time as we did hear noise from above us. No problem with noise from room net door although there was an adjoining door. Location was great. We only went as far north as St. Helena, which took forever on 2 lane highway. We had dinner reservations in Yountville which was a very quick trip as highway is 4 lanes to there.. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quaint revitalization of an old mill”
Reviews.Author: Truannsi
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my husband and have stayed here, this time our adult sons accompanied us and loved the place as well. The property was even nicer this time with improvements along the river's edge. The property is very accessible to the local wineries in addition to being located in downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Inn with modern touches”
Reviews.Author: DeanJC
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel without a reservation on a Friday night and was happy to get the last room available. I didn't expect much but I ended up with a spacious room with 2 queen beds, a large bathroom and balcony. The bed was extremely comfortable and if it wasn't for the guest above doing jumping jacks at 7am, I probably would have slept till 10. I went to the jazz club next door which proved to be an intimate setting to enjoy some great, live music. In addition, they had a splendid variety of wines by the glass and free appetizers. Several nice restaurants within the complex as well as a short walking distance. The staff was very accomodating with all requests and wanted to make sure everything was in order. All in all, a great total experience

Reviews.Title: “relaxing, beautiful surroundings & room with great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: leesatPoplarBluff
Reviews.Content: Excellent restaurants associated with the Inn (Angele is fabulous) with great ambiance, wine lists par prices. Walking distance from several other great restaurants as well. Disappointed that vouchers for complimentary wine tastings at Silos were not redeemable as promised but breakfast vouchers were used & greatly appreciated for in room service & breakfast on the balcony! Weekly Chef's Festival was an added attraction as the most of the town restaurants shut down at 9pm!

Reviews.Title: “Great service but overpriced for the room”
Reviews.Author: dsa
Reviews.Content: The Napa area commands prices for hotel rooms that are double what you'd pay elsewhere such as in San Francisco so we knew what we were getting into. However, I was still disappointed in the room at the Napa River Inn for the price we paid. We chose the option of a river view and it's true that you can see the river but the rooms in the older building are fronted by the walkway along the river and the ramp that accesses the hotel. Because of this, you wouldn't want to fully open the curtains in rooms on the first floor of this hotel because literally people are walking within feet of your windows. It also means that you can hear average conversations as people walk by outside or everytime the bellhop goes by with the luggage cart. A second level room would provide at least more privacy although I would guess you can still hear the conversations outside - and those rooms cost another $50 for the priviledge. On the plus side, the bed was terrific with nice quality bedding, the room was very clean and had all the amenities you might need including bottles of water so great care was given to making sure guest are comfortable. The service at the front desk was friendly and efficient. The bakery next door provided great baked goods for the breakfast that comes with the room. We chose to stay at this hotel because it was located near downtown Napa, thinking we would like to take advantage of walking to stores and restaurants however Napa seems to be going through a downturn and many stores were empty and there really wasn't much to see. So as long as you know what you are getting into by choosing this location, it's a nice hotel and you might opt to pay more for a room to get a quieter and more private location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to come back and relax after a day at the wineries”
Reviews.Author: lilrabbit2002
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff and beautiful hotel. We stayed in the Hatt Building and would highly recommend those rooms. The breakfast that was delivered to your room each morning (included with the room) was delicious and freshly made. Looking forward to our return to Napa and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “CAIN CUSTOMER RELATIONS MANAGER GIVES BIG THUMBS UP”
Reviews.Author: CellarCat
Reviews.Content: My husband (Trinchero Winery) and I (Cain Vineyards & Winery) love what is happening along Napa's waterfront, with Angele, Silos, Oxbow and more. From time to time we are in need of a pampering place to spend the night easily before or after a wine event and have found a new home in the Napa River Inn. Impeccable linens. Quiet. Rooms facing the river or courtyard. Room-served breakfast (that can be taken outside to a table a long the river if desired). Noon check out. Within easy walking of a great night out. Clean. A no brainer. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “ROMANTIC”
Reviews.Author: sargesia
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a bed & breakfast in the internet. I found the Napa River Inn. It's our first B&B. It was my wifes 50th birthday. When we arrived at the location we were impressed. Very rustic and comfortable looking. As night time came it was a very romantic site. Especially with the river in the back ground and the way the lighting glowed upon the building. We stayed in the Superior room with a king size bed, we had the fireplace burning and the the door from the balcony opened. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. Wireless internet was excellent. All the staff were friendly and helpful. When our breakfast arrived it was better than i expected. We ate at the Celadon located in the same building. Our meal was excellent. We were seated by the fireplace. I could'nt have planned this any better. We will be returning. We had a very Romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a HoneyMoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joelcohena
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel on february for my honeymoon and we were expecting full luxury for the price that we paid, but as soon as we got there we found out that there wasn't such luxury. Is a classic hotel, with a very kind staff, but the rooms are very old. Every step you take the floor makes some strange noises, and you can here your noises as well as other rooms noises. I wouldn't be complaining if this hotel was cheaper, but for the price that i paid i could have stayed at the Marriot Spa and get much more for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ninamoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on the river side of the hotel....quiet, nice view and excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to take your Pets”
Reviews.Author: scotthaar
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with 3 pets. Me and my girlfrend needed a nice place to stay for the night and it was a delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic overnight stay in downtown Napa - great food, wine, song, and a bit of adventure”
Reviews.Author: 2BukChuk
Reviews.Content: I decided to be a bit more creative for my wife's 43rd birthday this year. She has had a difficult spring while undergoing chemo treatment for the past 3 months. But knowing how she loves life and lives for the moment, I signed us up for a balloon ride across Napa Valley. Since we needed to be at the meeting point at 5:30am, I decided we should stay overnight nearby. The Napa River Inn was within walking distance of the meeting point for the balloon ride and looked like a great spot right on the river. Mark and the folks at the Napa River Inn helped me organize the activities and went above and beyond to make sure this was a memorable event for my wife. In fact, it sounded so good I took off work early so we could eat dinner in Napa and then go to see a blues band play at Silo's. Unknown to me, the staff placed a bottle of cabernet wine and a personalized birthday card in the room for my wife. (She made me call to verify this wasn't a chargable item!) The room itself was luxurious and had everything we needed, including soft sheets, terry cloth robes, jazz cds, and a small fridge. In the morning, after gliding in the balloon across the mist covered valley, we came back to the room and rested. The staff recommended a few wineries close by and we stopped at the Andretti vineyard on the way home. If we didn't have 2 young kids waiting back home, we would have extended our stay for another night at the Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly service with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Before our first visit, we didn't realize that a full-course breakfast was included. The danishes, scones, bagels & croissants were baked on premise and we could smell the wonderful baking throughout the hotel....very delicious...juices, fruit cups, yogurt, eggs, quiche...such a good healthy variety...a most pleasant surprise. We went on the Wine Train and it was within a short walk from the Hotel. The rooms were beautiful and the beds were so comfortable! If we had any questions, they were directed to the person who could best answer them. This is our second stay and when we return to Napa, we will be heading right back. Highly recommend this hotel....oh, and if a balloon ride is in your plans, they pick you up right at the hotel and the champagne brunch is held at the hotel as well....how convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, charm & elegant”
Reviews.Author: Mommy_n_Me
Reviews.Content: Being allergic to pets, I was very concerned about Napa River Inn being so pets friendly.... Although part of me like to experience the "historic" side of this hotel, I was also worried it would be old` smelly.... and my allergy would be so bad that's gonna ruin the trip. Not to mention, later on, I found out ppl were saying 2 rooms in this hotel were haunted.... @.@ But it has received so many good reviews, and I've never stayed in a "haunted" hotel before..... I decided to give it a try, and made a last minute reservation -- the night before our trip to Napa. And I am glad we stayed in Napa River Inn, the experience was great! Although the check-in time is 4pm, we were able to check in to our room when we arrived the hotel shortly after 2pm, and we were automatically upgraded from standard room to executive room with a king size bed, that's just perfect for me & my 6Y & 4Y kids. The front desk staff was very nice & detailed. Our room was at the corner of the 2nd floor at Embarcadero building. The room was roomy enough for my 2 girls to play in the room. One thing I especially love about Napa River Inn was we were able to leave the window opened during the stay to enjoy the fresh cool breeze in the room. Although the drawback of that was also hearing the noise of loud music from the drive-by cars... and the clinking sound from pushing the cart w/ glass bottles... that's probably from the hotel restaurant .... Luckily these noises quiet down quickly around 9 or 10pm without disturbing our sleep. The location of this hotel is another plus. The reason I wanted to stay in downtown Napa was so that I could experience the place by walking, but wouldn't tire my 2 young kids too much. There was a riverfront trail just behind Napa river inn, the girls loved walking up & down the stairs, and going thru the "tunnels"..... and seeing the 2 ducks/geese (I couldn't remember) near the hotel's restaurant patio. With being so concerned about the pet odor in the room prior to our stay.... I found myself over worried.... The reason I didn't give a 5 stars is the location of the a/c in the room -- yes, I am picky. Although we did not use it at all, thanks to the window & the spring breeze in April, I didn't like it's right next to the bed..... imagine I had to turn it on if staying during hot summer or cold winter... the air from the a/c would almost directly blow on my head when laying down on the bed.... it's just not a comfortable feeling.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: EstelleNJ
Reviews.Content: Your staff is wonderful - you should give them all a raise! Restaurant also good

Reviews.Title: “Love the Napa River Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooner14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned for a second time to the Napa River Inn to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary. It is a wonderful, cozy hotel with great service! We had booked a standard room, but becuase I follow the hotel on twitter, they were nice enough to upgrade us to a superior room with a fireplace and view of the river! When we arrived, we asked the front desk agent where we could buy a bottle of wine, but since the General Store down the street had closed already, she sent up a complimentary bottle to our room - which was very sweet! We also loved having our breakfast from Sweety Pie's delivered every morning - try the a.m. buns, they are delicious :)

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: jhbart
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay, good location. Have stayed there at least 6 times in the last year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: cpkh
Reviews.Content: We loved Napa River Inn. My husband & I took our daughter for 21st birthday to "food and wine tasting" at Mustard Festival. Location could not have been better. Festival was on Inn property with restaurants, shopping, etc within a short walking distance. Have to mention the delicious breakfasts delivered to your room. Could travel back just for breakfast. We had the best time!

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating and Awesome, neverheard the word NO”
Reviews.Author: kcauntie
Reviews.Content: Loved it from the minute we got there early and were able to check in early to gettingour wonderful breakfasts at different times that originally asked for. Everythingn we asked was done. A rea value on the price but the service all the way down to the bellhops was great. Going back again in March. Great massages, food, ambience everything!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: LisaArnold
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love the Napa River Inn! Located in what was once an old mill, it has been completely renovated, but retains lots of charm. The place has a wonderful Napa feel, yet the amenities of a larger hotel. The restaurant on site was great, the gift shop had a lot to offer, and the views were charming. There's even a jazz club right downstairs! We could walk downtown to shop, eat, or visit wine Co-ops. Our room also had a balcony and fireplace, and when they heard it was our anniversary, they sent champagne to our room! Convenient driving distance to all the wineries, too!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect homebase for Napa Valley trips!”
Reviews.Author: Toister
Reviews.Content: My wife and I discovered the Napa River Inn on our first trip to Napa in 2003 and we've stayed there once a year ever since. It's a perfect place to experience Napa Valley for two big reasons. First, it's restaurants, wine bar, and bakery draw a lot of locals who will gladly give you insider tips on exploring Napa Valley. Second, it's a very nice hotel that's stumbling distance from many restaurants in downtown Napa -- an important consideration after a long day of wine tasting. PROS Spend the extra few bucks to upgrade from their standard room and you'll get a fireplace, balcony, or both. Their rooms are very comfortable and well-appointed. The best part is the included breakfast from Sweetie Pies Bakery (delivery to your room included) and the nightly wine tasting coupons! We opt to go out to Sweetie Pies (it's in the complex) because locals stop in there, so it's a great place to meet a few people and get the local scoop. And, Silo's Wine and Jazz club is outstanding! Keith, the manager, is always happy to make a winery recommendation so you just might find yourself modifying your wine tasting plans for the next day! CONS The room decor is a bit dated for our taste. Of course, it's all in good condition and they've recently upgraded the bedding, so it's not bad. THE SKINNY Why stay at some B&B in the middle of nowhere when you can have good food, good nightlife, and a perfect homebase in the Napa River Inn? We love this place and will continue to go here year after year, even though we know we can get a better rate at similar hotels nearby. Other hotels just don't have their total package.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location.”
Reviews.Author: stoecdo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon. Romantic setting, attentive staff and a great location. Close to local restaurants and access to 29 and the silverrado trail. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I can ever imagine there is for a group function”
Reviews.Author: Msprof68
Reviews.Content: The service is amazing, the rooms are great, the catering options (for business functions) are limited, but the things that are offered are exquisite. The desk staff remember your name, and the housekeepers do an amazing job. And, if you're doing a "group" function (we had about 40 participants), Karen and Lisa are delightful to work with. When it's our group's time to return to Napa, I will definitely recommend that we go to Napa River Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: grandmahiker
Reviews.Content: First the pluses - great location in a historic hotel in downtown Napa within walking distance of restaurants. Comfortable bed. Nice spa toiletries. Caledon in house restaurant was good with friendly service. Sweetie Pie's for breakfast was certainly a different hotel type of breakfast and was very good. Be aware that the rooms vary greatly and if you luck out and get a nice large room with no one on either side of you it will be a good stay. We arrived on Dec. 21st for two nights when I would guess the hotel was about 20% occupied. Our friends had arrived the day before and after turning down a room in the Embarcadero Bldg. got a room above the reception area and it was lovely. We asked to be in the same building but got told that was not an option, weren't offered the option to upgrade, and we got put in the Embarcadero buidling. The room was very small, hardly room to turn around, one window overlooking a parking lot, and paper thin walls which was my main complaint. We could hear the conversation in the next room, that night I mentioned this to the front desk but wasn't offered a change of room. The next night they found it necessary to put someone on the other side of us, our headboards must of shared a wall for I could hear everything going on in their room until late at night. I got our paper the next morning at 6:45 AM and looking up and down the hall I only saw 3 papers and you guessed it, ours and the rooms on either side of us. I'm not sure why they couldn't space guests out except maybe it is easier for the maids. Our friends in the main building noticed the same lack of papers up and down their hall. When we checked in we were told we didn't get breakfast because we had booked through hotels.com and we felt like we were given the worst room in the inn because of this. No turndown service the first night. With the low occupancy rate they should have been happy to have the two rooms booked by our party no matter how we booked.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Gem!”
Reviews.Author: FoodTravelerAZ
Reviews.Content: Napa River Inn is both charming and comfortable. Spacious rooms and amenities are nice. Get a historic room if possible, it's well worth it. Rooms were well insulated (very little neighborly noise), had fireplaces and spacious bathrooms. Only drawback was one of our shower heads was not working properly. Not a big deal, there were two! This location is great because it's right in downtown Napa and nestled within the hotel is one of the most amazing bakery/cafes you will ever go to, Sweetie Pies!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location, you never have to leave”
Reviews.Author: SassySicilian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is consistently a relaxing weekend. The rooms are wonderfully situated on the Napa River. They have 2 wonderful restaurants on property, a general store, wine store, and jazz club. I've yet to partake of the jazz club (because I travel with my dog) but the performers I know from other clubs, and they are well worth while. If you want a relaxing vacation without much of the fuss of driving to and fro the Silverado Trail, you can walk to downtown, enjoy the riverfront and some fabulous meals right within the hotel complex. We also had a great massage at the spa associated with the hotel. Breakfast is served promptly at your time desired, and one of the best yet features, is a relaxing noon checkout time. If you want to enjoy the hotel, relaxing by the fireplace, great and attentive service and just not fuss with going too far, this hotel has every ammenity you could possibly desire. This is my 3rd stay...excellent each time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and wonderful accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: archdude
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see the previous review, as I too, booked a conference for 25 of my top customers. I was thrilled with everything about this hotel from the service, the rooms, and especially the food. The sales and catering staff were extremely flexible on attrition and cancellatioin (unlike most corporate hotels I work with) which was important to me as I was unable to guarantee exactly how many would show up. We worked together to provide an exceptional experience for my clients. We LOVED Silo's and the complimentary wine hour. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: ENKCharleston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Inn for one night. The room was wonderful. Our bed was very comfortable. We had a balcony looking out to the courtyard with a view of the river. The complimentary breakfast was great. It was a breakfast in bed type of service with us choosing the night before what beverages, sandwich, and danish we would like. It was delivered on time and was very tasty. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helped us so much in planning out our day for which wineries to visit. The wireless internet service was great. The hotel even had a computer with printer available in the lobby for us to use for free. We had a wonderful time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “misleading, and poor management-way too expensive for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: lyrics11
Reviews.Content: I was producing a conference last year and I decided to put 30 of my clients in this hotel. A week after I made my reservation, which was three weeks before I was to arrive, our dates changed and we could only stay 2 days, not 3. They were incredibly inflexible and already charged my credit card the full rate of 3 days. They lied and told me that they were full occupancy.. When we arrived, we realized that we were practically the only guests in the hotel, there was alot of construction going on day and night, so it was constant noise and pollution. There were 5 rooms that smelled like cat urine...Worst of all, there were quite a few of my clients that asked for wake-up calls and mostly everyone did not receive their wake-up call or they were called 45 minutes later. Overall, I was very disappointed with the management and were more concerned with making money of my company than customer service,.,NEVER, EVER GO THERE FOR BUSINESS, LET ALONE PLEASURE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with great service, would stay again in a minute.”
Reviews.Author: valinmonroe
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel last week. The room is beautiful and everything you would need is included. My husband and I loved, loved the bed, we could of stayed in it all day. The breakfast is included in the price of the room and it is spectacular. Included is nightly turn down service and chocolate. My husband and I were celebrating our 35th Anniversary and when we arrived there was a bottle of wine waiting for us. Plenty of restaurants with walking distance. I would come back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Inn with great service and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: kegdew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights with another couple. Service requests answered promptly. Dinner at Angele was terrific. Beautiful Grounds. Excellant location. Breakfasts delivered to room a nice touch

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be based for Napa valley”
Reviews.Author: Martino52
Reviews.Content: An interesting hotel in an historic and newly renovated complex of stores and restaurants. Friendly, attentive but discrete staff. Beautiful rooms. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: gderaleau
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Napa where we celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary. We were looking for something romantic and unique and we definitely found it with the Napa River Inn. The staff was great and very helpful. A big Shout Out to Renee Chaney, concierge and Armando. They were quick with suggestions and answered every question. They made us feel special and always took time to help us no matter how mundane a request. Our room was clean and very comfortable. We had a room overlooking the patio but noise was never an issue. Overall this was a great place to stay and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: vacationseeker31
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay at the Napa River Inn. We had an "amazing" vacation. The staff was friendly, the hotel was perfect. Great location, walking distance to several restaurants. Renee the Concierge helped us ahead of time with planning our wine tour, she was great. We would love to stay again. We could not have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Urban inn in a rural setting”
Reviews.Author: Sanduskian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days here during our honeymoon and had an outstanding experience. The inn offers a full range of guest services ( with the notable exception of a pool) but the friendly staff, excellent service and close proximity o downtown Napa more than make up for the relatively small grounds. On site are two excellent restaurants and Renee, our concierge, was always available to help us find tables at other restaurants (as well as organizing our bike tour and hot air balloon ride). While those seeking farmhouses and country side will find Napa River Inn's downtown setting a bit urban, if you like walking home from dinner to a very quiet and romantic bedroom, you will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for your Napa stay”
Reviews.Author: MumaRules
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from 10 nights in California - spent at 4 different lodgings. The Napa River Inn was a nice hotel, centrally located in the heart of downtown Napa. Many restaurants were within walking distance, a plus in my book. We stayed in the Embarcadero Building for 2 nights, on the 2nd floor, in a room with a fireplace, balcony and river view. The view was not noteworthy, but we enjoyed eating our breakfast on the balcony. The room was not large (considering this was called a deluxe room) and the queen-sized bed was about a foot from the wall, making it difficult to exit. Our bathroom sink had drainage problems, filling almost to the brim while waiting for hot water to emerge from the faucet. The turndown service was a nice touch, especially since they left 2 champagne-shaped chocolates on the bed. The concierge was very helpful, making reservations for us, as well as assisting us in our wine touring itinerary. We ate at Angele, one of the on-site restaurants, and were extremely disappointed. It was ordinary food, ordinary service, and overpriced. There are too many great restaurants in Napa and the surrounds to eat at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: SFO116
Reviews.Content: The staff greated us promptly and were very friendly. The hotel was gorgeous and the rooms were quite spacious and decorated beautifully. The breakfast was awesome, freshly baked goods. A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Embarcadero Building (2nd Floor) - River Side”
Reviews.Author: BeachMax
Reviews.Content: Room selection is critical: If you want to sleep, choose the Embarcadero Building (2nd Floor) => Make sure to Face the River => Away from Parking Lot or Restaurant area. Rooms vary tremendously from one building to another and within each building. Beds are comfortable; Style is good for the parents (nautical / historical / browns + golds); water pressuer on shower is limited; some rooms have fireplace + balconys. Concierge is excellent. Celedon restaurant and Sweetie Pies were the highlights. Parking is ample + easy. Check-in/Check-out efficient. River View is mediocre => they need to invest in a public works project to fix the other side of the river => a little greenery or art would help.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tryonemoretime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Napa River Inn. We booked an executive room with balcony and view of the river. Size of the room was excellent and the balcony overlooked the courtyard. The turn down service was a nice touch with chocolate (in the shape of wine bottles) left on the pillows. Great location for touring the wineries as well as the town of Napa itself. Many restaurants and bars are within walking distance. Had breakfast at the restaurant next to hotel and food was excellent. If you like bike riding, there are bike rentals available at this hotel too. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to see the fireworks on Fourth of July”
Reviews.Author: 05sally
Reviews.Content: My husband, kids and myself stayed at the Napa River Inn on the fourth of July. We chose the hotel because of their excellent reputation and location. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very well appointed. We stayed on the river side and were able to watch the fireworks from our balcony. It was a treat being able to see the fireworks from the comfort of our own room. We will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Inn. Great Location and Value. Excellent Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: meganSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Went mid-week and the service was excellent. Fresh cucumber water and lemon iced tea in the lobby. Convenient location near sweetie pies bakery and historic downtown. Loved the free breakfast from sweetie pies. Didn't like the onsite restaurant, Celadon but it is an easy walk to other restaurants and local attractions and the concierge arranged tours easily. Wonderful experience. I'll be back for sure . :)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant in every way. Will definately be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Kingmatt85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa River Inn while touring across the US. This is by far the nicest stop we have had throughout (and we've had our fair share over 6 weeks). We booked off their well designed website as they were able to offer us a 'best rate guarantee'. It was easy to find in downtown Napa and we were able to pull in to a vacant registration parking space. We turned up at about 1pm which was slightly ahead of schedule. The girl on front desk was extremely polite and helpful and checked to see if our room was ready. Unfortunately it wasn't....though she upgraded us to a superior king room with a balcony on to the beautiful river with lovely fireplace!! The rooms are very classy well furnished, very comfortable, warming feel to them. There's a nice big LG flatscreen above the fireplace which was great. The parking was free and they give you a ticket to pop in the front of your vehicle window with your departure date on. With a cafe and nice restuarant on your doorstep it was a great place to stay. We walked 5mins down the road to a bar called 'Downtown Joes' which was a great bar, very welcoming and friendly. When we arrived on Friday we had no plans for a guided wine tour and were going to attempt it to do it ourselves. We went down to concierge and spoke with the friendly lady on the desk, we ended up booking a next day limo tour with Beau wine tours $125pp. It was such a great recommendation. We enjoyed it sooo much. And would recommend it to anyone else. Our driver Gary was a brilliant chap and knew everything about wines, without making you feel stupid. Overall Napa River Inn was a fantastic stay and great experience I will never forget. If I get the chance to travel here again I will re-book at the drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to a beautiful day”
Reviews.Author: LookKidsTheresBigBen
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our day trip in Napa and our stay at the Napa River Inn. The staff was friendly, the dinner at Celadon was surprisingly delicious after we had thought our taste buds had retired from a day at the wineries, beds were comfortable, and Sweet Pie Bakery's sticky bun brightened our morning.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice In Napa”
Reviews.Author: VVBklyn
Reviews.Content: Although the set up isn't your typical, with everything under one confined roof, I was enchanted by this historic boutique hotel in a refurbished riverside mill. The room was ample and beautifully appointed. The bathroom was all marble and plush towels and robes. The working fireplace was an added plus! And, the fact that this historic square includes a top-notch wine country restaurant, wine bar and bakery was a plus plus!

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks on the road between SF, LV, Reno and Napa”
Reviews.Author: roastedtoasted
Reviews.Content: And this is the biggest spot of heaven that we could find. Coffee and hot water in the rooms. Front desk couldn't have been more personable. Room decor was brilliant, the bland colors of regular hotel wallpaper and bad hotel art is replaced by stylishly color contrasted wallpaper and art prints. Fresh air windows, wonderful French restaurant, couldn't be better. Oh, and free wireless. That alone saved us 20 bucks. A joy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and charming hotels provides everything needed for a trip to Napa!!”
Reviews.Author: doogiendylan
Reviews.Content: My friend and I found the Napa River Inn to be the perfect spot to stay in when visiting the area. The hotel is a beautiful historic location with cozy, well appointed rooms. The breakfast spot downstairs is fabulous as well as the other restaurants attached to the property. The wineries and shopping are easily reached from this location! Thanks to the Inn for their service and keeping it so charming!!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of Napa!!!”
Reviews.Author: ATL_LAGirl
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel!!! Upon our arrival, the front desk attendant was very hospitable and gave us a complimentary upgrade to a cozy room with a fireplace. Also, it's centrally located in downtown Napa surrounded by several great restaurants. We had a fabulous dinner next door at Angele, which the hotel recommended. With sweet aromas filling the hotel the following morning, we had a delicious breakfast at Sweetie Pies. In addition, the concierge service at the hotel was extremely helpful in suggesting great wineries for tours and tastings.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this lodge”
Reviews.Author: victorslinda
Reviews.Content: We saw a t.v. program about this historic hotel in downtown Napa. We booked a room for one night with family. Everyone was so friendly and the rooms were warm and cozy. Breakfast was included and WHAT a breakfast!! So impressed with the delivery and we even ate out on our balcony on a warm, sunny, January morning in Napa Valley! You don't even have to ever drive! Restaurants, wine tasting, shopping...you name it! It's all right there! Very cool. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!!! Thank you Napa River Inn!!! P.S. They are even "pet friendly"!!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous Staff and Great Customer Service at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: poohshek
Reviews.Content: We got a free night stay using Citi Rewards and the location of the hotel is within walking distance to quite a variety of restaurants. Breakfast is included with the room rate and it is delivered to your door. Try the quiche and scones. The baked goods are delicious!!! I will not recommend this hotel for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Experience”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Touring
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa River Inn for a Saturday night weekend getaway. I booked directly through the hotel website 2 weeks before. On the week of the stay, I checked the hotel website and discovered a lower rate for an upgraded room was being offered. Changing the reservation through the site to this new rate was easy. We arrived at 2:00 pm and were efficiently checked in by a friendly receptionist. We were given a room in the 2nd floor facing the river with a balcony in the Embarcadero building. It was a lovely and spacious room with a nautical theme. The wood paneling and gold tone decoration along with the fireplace make the room warm and inviting. We can see the Angele Restaurant patio from the balcony with the river walk right below us. No problem with noise. The Napa river is not the most scenic but still was interesting, with flocks of ducks and we saw an egret catching its dinner from the balcony. The riverwalk was a nice stroll to downtown. The downtown is being revitalized and has quite a number of interesting restaurants and wine bars. The complimentary breakfast from Sweetie Pie was great. We had it on the balcony and watched the sunrise. Autumn is a lovely time in Napa, with colors changing (visit Napa-Bothe State Park for a nice hike), and especially with the lowered room rate, Napa River Inn is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Historic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: CarlyMc_8
Reviews.Content: The Napa River Inn recaptures the history of the best of the City of Napa. The hotel has been lovingly restored, with beautiful rooms, a lovely view of the Napa River and Riverwalk. Hotel service is wonderful, and the breakfast served in your room from the property's nearby bakery, "Sweetie Pie's" is delicious enough to carry you through to the dinner hour! Easy walking distance to many fine restaurants, the Napa Opera House, and the renovated city center. It will be even more beautiful when construction in the area is complete, but despite construction work and fences, there was very little disturbance for guests. I'll return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Noise is a significant issue”
Reviews.Author: BC-Westcoaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Inn for 2 nights in October. It is walking distance from downtown Napa, and we liked being able to walk to the shops and restaurants, leaving our car behind. Our room with 2 double beds not overly large, though the bathroom was a good size. It was clean and nicely decorated, and included a mini-fridge. The beds are foam rather than spring, and we found them too soft; by the second night we both had backaches. There was an air-conditioner in the room, which many accommodations in this area do not have, but it was very loud when running. Breakfast from a nearby bakery is included in the rate – you note your selections on a card that you hang in your door, and it is delivered to your room at a time you select in the morning. Everything we had was of excellent quality, and the quantity was more than adequate. This was a nice feature. However, I simply cannot recommend this as a place to stay because of the noise. There is a great deal of construction in the area and it is loud, so you can’t plan to sleep past 7:30 or 8:00 a.m. In addition, we could clearly hear the sounds of the people in the room above us walking and talking, and noise from the hallway was also significant. To top it off, our room was located across from the restaurant, which stays open late on weekends and was also a source of some significant noise. I would not consider staying here again until the construction is complete, and only if I could be guaranteed a top floor room away from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Napa River Inn!”
Reviews.Author: bld2078
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Napa and wanted to get away for a night and went the the Napa River Inn. It was fantastic, the staff helped us to our room, explained the history of the hotel, and treated us as if we were true tourists! We went to the new hang out Silo's and had wine and desert and listened to jazz music by a local musician. We would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Napa, plus you can walk to several great restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this place!”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaMelody_B
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this inn. We've returned to it multiple times and already have our next trip planned. They are very dog-friendly and the staff always makes us feel so welcome. (There is even a welcome basket for our pooch - with a blanket, bowls and treats!) We love the huge breakfast delivered to our door; the rooms are great (wireless internet and wine glasses at the ready), and the location to downtown Napa is perfect for walking - especially along the recently completed river walk.

Reviews.Title: “A trip highlight!”
Reviews.Author: CityChic_Hil
Reviews.Content: Wow. My husband and I just returned from a week-long anniversary trip to San Francisco, Napa, and Sonoma. The Napa River Inn was the first of three hotels that we stayed in during our five nights in wine country, and we left wishing we had spent the whole week there! We selected it for the first two nights of our trip because of great proximity to the vineyards, and many downtown locations as well. The rate ($224 when I booked) was also incredibly reasonable for the area (a not-so-pleasant surprise when we started looking!) But this hotel was worth every penny. There is construction going on next door, which we were wary of at first but turned out not to be a big deal. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The bathroom featured a separate tub and tiled shower that I could have spent all day in. There was also a great coffee maker- one of those Keurig (sp?) ones that make coffee from the individual pods- which was AWESOME. We're big coffee drinkers so we really appreciated not having to buy great coffee each morning, and the hotel thoughtfully provided both mugs and to-go cups with lids. The breakfast in bed was fantastic! A choice of quiche or breakfast sandwhich with fruit and a choice of pastry- more than enough food and all excellent. The second morning, the man who brought it thoughtfully suggest we eat outside on the patio since we didn't have a balcony and there was no one there, and we enjoyed an awesome breakfast on the river. The staff was awesome. The recommendations of the staff were spot-on; I asked for a "cheap burger place" for dinner the one night after splurging at Celadon (which is amazing, by the way!), and was directed down the road to Taylor's Refresher for fantastic burgers and milkshakes! They included a coupon for a free wine tasting for two at the Bountry Hunter which was also a nice touch. In all, we had an awesome stay, and we ended up getting a great rate to boot- I noticed the week before I left that the rate on the website had dropped (to $189). I called and they graciously applied the new rate to our reservation. The next time we're in Napa, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “super friendly”
Reviews.Author: andromedababe
Reviews.Content: Our hearts sank when we saw the building site next door but we weren't ever bothered by noise/dust from there. The hotel is extremely friendly. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast is delivered to your room from the bakery next door and was lovely.Attached to the hotel are some small shops, a wine bar+art gallery and a restaurant. We were given a voucher for a glass of wine and claiming it was our best move as we met the wonderful Keith who runs the bar and the equally wonderful hotel asst. manager Shane(from Ireland). They couldn't do enough for us. We spent an evening in the gallery/bar listening to a jazz singer. Keith even ordered us a pizza(and because it came late he wouldn't let us pay for it!) Shane put us a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room. The reception staff are also lovely. We had a fab time and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “did not like it”
Reviews.Author: inn000000
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Napa River Inn. The Inn is located in downtown Napa. It is described as a “luxury hotel” on their web site and ideal for retreats. The hotel is also lauded for having a historic ambience. Unfortunately, we found all these things to be total exaggeration. The hotel is located right next to a huge, modern construction building. So much for the historical/retreat atmosphere. The rooms are OK, but not luxurious by any means and way too overpriced (we paid a rate of $280/night [with tax it was more like $300]), especially considering that you can get a similar price for much nicer hotels closer to the wineries in a much nicer setting. The TV did not work, free breakfast was also awful and the doorman did not offer to help us with our bags.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Ibanker
Reviews.Content: Small but expanding hotel with two great restaurants located in the same complex.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: snickm
Reviews.Content: On our visit to Napa in February, we spent a couple of nights at this great hotel. We booked a junior suite and paid about $200/night. The room was pretty large and had a recently updated feel to it, along with a king-size bed and huge tv in the room. The bathroom was probably the nicest I've ever seen in a hotel, and we especially enjoyed the huge bathtub in there (which is perfect for relaxing and enjoying the wine you've bought). There was also a couch and a balcony overlooking the Napa River. I will say that the view of the river really isn't anything too special. I wouldn't pay any extra for the balcony. There is a restaurant on-site where you can sit inside or outside near the river, and the food there is actually pretty good. The location of this hotel is definitely a big plus. COPIA is right down the street, as is the Napa Valley Wine Train (both of which I would highly recommend). Downtown is very close as well. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: byoung3rd
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay for 2 nights in Napa...right on the new river walk, balcony rooms overlooking the river....fireplace and refrigerator in rooms along with good coffee. Best of all, once you park at the hotel, you can walk to everything downtown...this is another great getaway place for those of you in the bay area!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss it!!!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleandKyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in Feb and would easily recommend this hotel to anyone. The pros: check-in was fast and friendly, we had a romance package that included chocolate-covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne (very nice!), the room was large and comfortable, everything was very clean, the breakfast included was AMAZING, great location - easy to walk to everything in Napa, parking is free The cons: Balcony was super tiny and not really usable, the floors creak when you walk on them, bed is pretty comfortable, but not overly so like a Marriott or Hilton bed For $189, you can't beat a great location, included breakfast, champagne, and strawberries and a clean room in the middle of downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great service”
Reviews.Author: GogoSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night last weekend, because we were seeing a show at the Napa Opera House, and didn't want to drive back to SF late on a Sunday evening. Check-in was very friendly and effiecient, and we were very pleasantly surprised by our room. We had a deluxe room in the newer Embarcadero Building, and it was very nice. The pictures of the rooms on the hotel web site looked a little fussy and claustrophobic, but our room was very nicely designed and included a fireplace, a sitting area and a balcony overlooking the Napa River. We booked it on their site as part of their "mustard package," which was $270 a night and included coupons for things like 10% discounts at the General Store and Sweetie Pies, coupons to a wine tasting, etc. The free breakfast was nice! They give you a room service tag to hang on your door by midnight, and in addition to pastries and things you can order things like a bacon/egg sandwich. This hotel worked out perfectly for us, and we'd stay again if we had plans in Napa. I wouldn't, however, consider this a "destination," hotel--in other words I wouldn't drive up to Napa just to stay there for the weekend. Although the staff and hotel itself are nice, the immediate area is not what I would call 'scenic.' As others mentioned, there's a lot of construction going on, and although it was nice to have a balcony, the view of the Napa river from the hotel with a busy highway beyond and industrial buildings is not exactly breathtaking. Also, when we arrived we went out to our balcony to have a drink before going to dinner, there was a group of what appeared to be homeless men sitting on the ground below us on the river bank drinking liquor from brown bags and being pretty loud. Being from SF, we're no strangers to the homeless problem, but it seemed like an odd thing to encounter at a hotel in wine country. I highly recommend dinner at Celadon, which is located in the same building as the hotel. We had a delicious dinner there, and awesome service.

Reviews.Title: “noisy aircon”
Reviews.Author: retiredincyprus
Reviews.Content: We had such serious problems with the air con/heating at night that we had to move out,it came on with a loud bang and went off with a crash as well as heating the room to boiling point and then going off and freezing us--this was in the older building,I don't know if the new ones are the same.We complained fairly bitterly but the staff said they could not adjust the aircon and it couldn't be switched off,they also said no one else had ever complained which was obviously the case as we found earplugs in the bedside draw. The breakfast is actually very good but if you can't sleep then the place has failed in it's purpose.We moved to the Solage resort at Calistoga which is first class.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: joelmari
Reviews.Content: We had bought a Napa package at a charitable auction that included two nights at this hotel, and we purchased an extra night, after staying in Calistoga for several days. The room does not seemworth $345 - the weekend rate, though it is large (15' x 18' ?)and had a nice bathroom in the historic Hatt building. (The AAA rate is $314.) We did not have a view of the river in #202, or a very big window, but we did have the use of a very nice sitting room on that floor, where we chose to have the excellent breakfast and read the papers every morning. The breakfast menu is a bit weird.... one of the choices is "juice, fruit, OR coffee". Luckily there is a fancy coffee maker in the room......Also, oatmeal is on Sweetie Pie's regular menu, so we just wrote that in - and they brought it. The all young staff was outstanding and very helpful - and the location is terrific. Nearby Celadon is a terrific restaurant with a good Zagat rating. The next door construction is a pain, but it should be wonderful when it is finished . Napa is not completely gentrified by any means and it is fun to walk in the morning and check out the old neighborhoods, the antique shops and other funky places. Gilwoods is an excellent local restaurant in the Town Center(also St. Helena) - not "gourmet", but nice food, well served.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Inn”
Reviews.Author: DickMacD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent two nights at this inn. Our room was clean, very comfortable and nicely furnished. Rates included an fine breakfast as well. The inn is close to downtown and several excellent restaurants. We enjoyed the food and jazz at Uva's and a fine italian dinner at Ristorante Allegria. Needless to say, the Napa area is beautiful and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place offering great value”
Reviews.Author: lisajoy924
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at Napa River Inn one evening, but found the experience wonderful. The staff was helpful, particularly Armando and Tiffany. They recommended perfect spots for our tours of Napa Valley and dinner spots. We had a delicious breakfast, and our room overlooked the river on the 2nd floor of the Embarcadero section. The room was small but comfortable, with high quality bedding and mattress. We hated leaving, and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Only a Few Rooms are worth the price”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithFriday
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel BUT only a few rooms are worth the price. -The Plaza building rooms look like any Holiday Inn. -All rooms overlook either a parking lot or the muddy river and industrial area beyond. -1st floor rooms get all sorts of foot traffic. -2nd floor rooms get music from the downstairs restaurant from 10am - 10pm. -The Embarcadero rooms are gorgeous - but try for one of the two upstairs rooms that do not overlook the parking lot and face away from the restaurant and its awful music. All in all, its a crapshoot - better off going someplace where the odds of a good room are in your favor...and you'll probably pay a whole lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn - Will be perfect when complete”
Reviews.Author: OhCurious1
Reviews.Content: We only got to stay here one night, but still was able to take advantage of the "Romance Package" (free chilled champagne in room and chocolate covered strawberries!). Since we stayed on a Friday night, we didn't have any issues with the construction going on - heard nothing relating to it. When we first pulled in, it looked like we were driving onto a construction site. THE ROOM: Nicely decorated (standard King/Queen room, 1st floor) and comfortable. All the amenities you'd expect and more. The free WiFi in the room was useful. The bathroom was a bit on the tiny side, but we were only there one night, so it didn't matter too much. Comfy robes provided. THE INN: Decorated on Thanksgiving weekend for the Christmas holiday, it was beautiful. We took advantage of the early evening wine tasting with cheese and crackers. Didn't socialize too much with the other occupants, but everyone seemed to be having a good time. THE BREAKFAST/BAKERY: Sweetie Pies bakery is right next to the lobby entrance. Breakfast from the bakery was brought to the room. The breakfast was nice and hot and very good! The bakery itself is very cute and quaint, even though the large menu above the register looks a bit crowded and confusing at first glance. THE GOOD: Plenty of choices where to eat within walking distance. There's 2 restaurants on-site and a little shop that serves pizzas and salads (among other things). Pop into Sweetie Pies for your morning mocha. THE BAD: One may be turned off by the construction - it is a little unsightly depending on your preference. I didn't mind it one bit as the rooms were perfectly fine!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: tuck78
Reviews.Content: We booked this place because it was affordable & in Napa. What a surprise! We didn't get to the property until late day so the construction didn't bother us. We love small, old hotels so this was perfect. The fact that it was new & beautifully decorated was a nice surprise. The fact that there were 2 great restaurants (we did Angele which was fantastic!) within steps of our door, plus an art gallery & general store made us wish we were staying longer than 1 night. The complimentary breakfast delivered from Sweetie Pies within the complex was a lovely finish to our visit. This is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property!”
Reviews.Author: Kipper2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. Staff was very accomodating. The delivery of breakfast to your room each day was a nice added touch. The only drawback was the hotel did not mention that they are totally under construction due to some flooding from the Napa River. We were told the construction has been ongoing for quite sometime. We were disappointed because we wanted a view room, which we got, but a view of scaffolding. We understand construction, but they should have mentioned it at booking and also, we feel the rates should be lowered. $229.00 a night for a construction zone is a bit high in our opinion. The nightly wine and cheese party was nice. We loved the robes in our rooms too!! klbabich@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “I Love Historic Hotels”
Reviews.Author: MimiSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly wonderful, it brings together the elements of a great historic landmark, with well thought out modern conveniences and super efficient service. Our room was beautiful and clean, with every detail of our comfort considered. And we just loved the staff. It was like having our own personal team taking care of us. We've visited the Napa Valley many times, and chose The Napa River Inn this time because some close friends recommended it. What a find! The hotel's central location and ease as a starting point to the entire Napa Valley made our visit so great. Even the river construction, which seems to be affecting the whole of downtown Napa, didn't bother us very much. The staff more than made up for any inconveniences-which weren't a big deal. We can't wait to visit the Napa Valley again, and stay at our new favorite hotel. We've already referred it to friends. btw, the restaurant is this fabulous combination of French bistro, incredibly fresh and beautifully prepared food, with a great staff and service. Also the bakery is to die! with fresh-baked everything to start the day. This is a gem of a find.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful historic hotel with lots of charm to love.”
Reviews.Author: havetimewilltravelto
Reviews.Content: My memories of the Napa River Inn are filled with warmth and pleasure. I was delighted with the service of a very conscientious staff as well as the beautifully appointed room that I stayed in. Unlike other hotels that I have stayed in which are so modern that they have lost all character, the Napa River Inn has old world charm and history. I loved the history of the hotel which is integral to the history of Napa Valley itself. My usual habit while travelling is to throw my stuff down and use my room simply as storage and a place to lay my head at night. This is because I find most hotel rooms to be slightly cold and impersonal. However, this was one hotel which was an exception to the rule. I loved the comfortable bed, and the feeling of "home" that the decorator and staff have somehow managed to achieve. I was not at all in a hurry to leave my room - although the Inn is a great launching pad to tour Napa Valley. I have heard that the area around the Inn is being developed - and that there will be restaurants and stores which will only add to the attraction of the Inn. Can't wait for my next opportunity to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Napa”
Reviews.Author: luv10s
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely restored hotel, but, don't plan on sleeping here. This is our first night and we were awakened at 3:00 AM to the sounds of an 18 wheeler unloading a delivery for a restaurant on the property. My spouse successfully has gone back to sleep because we turned on the air conditioner for some white noise, but, I'm freezing and sitting here writing this review. Our room is a deluxe room and overlooks the Napa River and a construction zone. ($320/night) There are no drawers for clothing except for the two small drawers in each night stand. It does have a fireplace and small cramped sitting area, as well as a separate bath & shower. However, there's only a very small sink area. We'll probably kill one another if we try to get dressed at the same time. Last night we ate at the restaurant receiving the delivery (Angele) and it was excellent. If you stay here, insist on a room as far away from the main hotel as possible. Now, I know why ear plugs are provided.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Captain Hatt Suite”
Reviews.Author: ronb6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and nicely restored. We had booked a premium "Historic Suite" and received the key to the Captain Hatt Suite. The room was large and well decorated. It was very clean. We were initially delighted. At about 2:30 AM, we were awaken by the clanging of pots, pans and oven doors. After some thought, we realized that our suite was directly on top of "Sweetie Pies" the bakery. As you would expect, the noise didn't stop until breakfast was finished. We asked to be moved, and, the next day were told that we could move down the hall. The room was much smaller (probably a standard room) with only one tiny window overlooking the street. It was still well decorated and very clean. Apparently during the major renovation, they forgot insulation or soundproofing. We could still hear conversations and squeeky beds from adjoining rooms, but at least no bakery noise. There are so many wonderful hotels in Napa that we would not return to the Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Restored the senses!”
Reviews.Author: Bahookie
Reviews.Content: Revival of the road weary spirits & senses! We were midway through a road trip from Wisconsin to California and back. And on the return trip by the time we got to Napa valley we were sick to the back teeth with the banality of big chain hotels (apparently 4 and 5 star establishiments). The Napa River Inn restored our senses and spirits. The Hotel reception is small but welcoming. Within the complex there are three eateries, 2 options offering dinner al fresco and a bakery/cafe for breakfast. We were located in a newer building just behind the main reception. The rooms are bright, clean and cheerful. We were on the groundfloor and though we overlooked one of the restaurants al fresco dining room we were not disturbed & slept very soundly. Breakfast was served in the bakery; a choice of fresh pastries & fruit - perfect to redeem ourselves from the excesses of the night before. Needless to say we spent the remainder of the trip home back to Wisconsin desperately seeking accomodation to match!!! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great girls trip”
Reviews.Author: TSTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great staff makes this a nice choice, but construction is a drawback. When we first checked in at 3 p.m. on a Thursday, the whole building was shaking. At about 4, they quit for the day, and we didn't hear them at all on Friday or Saturday. There's a lot of fencing, which ruins the views. It will be great when it's all done though. This hotel is an older property (very well maintained) just a couple blocks from the main activity in Napa. It's an easy walk to many great restaurants and shopping. On property are several restaurants too. Checkin and checkout was smooth and quick. My deluxe suite was spacious with a gas fireplace and wood paneled walls. There weren't dressers, just cedar chests at the ends of the beds. The bath products were wine themed and really nice, and we had two nice fluffy robes. The tea (mighty leaf tea co) and coffer were top brands. Everything was sparkling clean. I am allergic to feathers. After informing the front desk, I left for about an hour and when I got back, the room had been changed out. The replacement pillows and comforter were just as comfortable as the original feather products, which is hardly ever the case. In fact, the bed was divine. Breakfast at Sweetie Pies (a cute little breakfast place) was included, and it was delicious! The quiche was the fluffiest I have ever had. Overall, it was a great base for our visit to the area, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a wine country stay”
Reviews.Author: BDSTravels
Reviews.Content: There is major construction going on by this hotel for the foreseeable future (I believe it's expected to end mid-2008). As such, it's a bit loud during the week after 7:30AM. When we asked the front desk about it on our second day, they immediately offered a discount on our daily rate. It was much appreciated and was indicative of the kind service we received throughout our stay over 3 days. The Inn is located conveniently to walk to great restaurants in the evening and to drive to either the Napa or the Sonoma vineyards. Breakfast each morning is delivered to your room at the time you select from the bakery downstairs (or you can eat there if you prefer). The bakery items were REALLY good and altogether plentiful for breakfast. We'll definitely stay here again when back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Meese
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband and I, and 4 other couples, based solely on previous reviews I had read on TripAdvisor. Let me tell you, we were NOT disappointed. I had read about the construction, but it was not an issue at all. We did sleep in one morning and heard construction, but housekeeping had left us earplugs next to our bed. We popped them in and went right back to sleep. The hotel itself is very quaint and has every convenience imaginable. The bed and pillows were SO comfortable, and the electric fireplace was a nice added amenity. We stayed in room 219 and had a view of the river and access to a shared balcony, which was a great place to enjoy drinks before going to dinner (and a convenient place for all the guys to enjoy post-dinner drinks into the wee hours). Breakfast, courtesy of Sweetie Pies, was unbelievable. I have never had a complimentary breakfast as good as theirs. I would definitely stay here again, if given the chance. The location was very convenient to downtown restaurants. We ate at Celadon, Angele, (both of which are downstairs from our room), ZuZu, and Greystone in St. Helena. I highly recommend all of them. All 10 people in our group were extremely satisfied with our hotel experience, and I can't say enough good things about the Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in Napa”
Reviews.Author: ao23
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary of booking here because I heard about the construction. While I could see it from the balcony, I wasn't disturbed by noise or anything because I think they must limit it to working hours on weekdays. I chose this hotel because it was within walking distance to some great restaurant choices. Zuzu serves tapas right up the street and was the best meal of my entire trip; I dream about the heirloom tomato tarte tatin. I also had a great day with the Napa Winery Wine Shuttle; it's affordable and I was impressed with the variety of wineries we went to and and the friendliness and knowledge of our guide. On another day, the concierge booked a car service for me to visit some wineries and I also thoroughly enjoyed that as well. Lastly, I had read about the amazing breakfast in bed from Sweetie Pie's and I was underwhelmed, primarily because the choices were limited and I did not like the egg sandwich at all. However, I asked at the front desk if I could bring my ticket to the bakery and they substituted things of equal value, which I liked a lot better. The almond croissants are delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel- less than desireable location”
Reviews.Author: saltandpepper242
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, this is a beautiful historic property. The rooms were magnificent- very elegant and very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful. Rhianna, ,the concierge, was very helpful in her suggestions and in booking our reservations. Breakfast at Sweetie Pie, the bakery next door, was delicious, as were their snacks and desserts. We did not get to eat at Celadon, the restaurant in the hotel, although I know they did get rave reviews. We did eat at the restaurant a few doors down, Angele, and the meal was superb. With all that said, the location at this point in time was disappointing. We had a room with a balcony, but it overlooked construction right under our room, and the view across the river was that of an industrial strip. So there was no reason to go out on the balcony, and in fact we kept the blinds closed. They are constructing a riverwalk, which will make the property lovely when it is completed, but right now the construction around the hotel makes it less than relaxing, and an eyesore. We woke up on our second morning, which was Monday, to the sound of construction equipment right under our window at 7:30 in the morning. Once the riverwalk is finished, I think this will be a lovely hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great!! But Construction...”
Reviews.Author: ahstraveler
Reviews.Content: great hotel. we booked a standard room. they do not let you choose the type of bed (2 queens, or king) on their website -- bummer. but all i had to do was call in and requested a king for my girlfriend and i. the room was fantastic. great view of the river. clean bathroom. it's right there near main street. you can walk to a ton of great restaurants. there is a bakery that provides complimentary breakfast delivered to your room at a specified time. my advice, be very specific on the card they give you at check-in. there is only one downside. they are doing some major construction all around the hotel. so there is some noise. we were there for one night (monday) so i don't know if they do construction during the weekend. there really wasn't that much noise and we were not woken up by them, but they are there and it just may have been a slow day when we were there. i would totally recommend this place. and i would go there again, even with the construction. by the way, if you do make it up there, you have to walk to Zu Zu (tapas restaurant). it is by far one of the best places to eat and it is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location...”
Reviews.Author: pianos101
Reviews.Content: We decided to come to Napa about 3 weeks before we were planning to come, so finding a room was not the easiest. We went down the TripAdvisor list to see what was available and Napa River Inn was the highest rated with availability. Well, there was definitely a reason for it's high rating. Located in an old, converted mill in a "strip" mall with a few restaurants and a bakery, it didn't really seem like a "hotel" location. After checking-in in the beautiful lobby, we were told that our room was in the Plaza building, the one behind the main building. We had a room on the first floor, and the view from our "balcony" was of the restaurant Celadon across the alley. There were some bushes that somewhat blocked our room, so that was not at all a problem. The room was a pretty nice size with 2 queen beds (3 of us). The bathroom was huge, and they gave a big basket of spa products. The free breakfast was amazing... It was from the bakery Sweetie Pies, next door to the lobby of the hotel. You get a choice of items, like an egg sandwich or fruit with yogurt and granola, and danish or low-fat mini cake (it was icky), juice or coffee... ALL of the items were freshly made and delivered right to the room. The egg sandwiches were the best, though; they were more like omelets on a bagel... very good and fresh... People have mentioned construction, and it was this reason that we didn't pay for a river view room. We didn't hear any construction noise, so no problems there... All in all this was a really place, and wasn't super expensive either. It was a short walk to the "center" of Napa where all the restaurants are. Great place...

Reviews.Title: “no view and musty smell”
Reviews.Author: Bessie57
Reviews.Content: You should know that the Napa River is brown, with not a speck of blue or green, and there is construction going on (for flood control we were told) so don't get your hopes up. A vineyard view at another hotel would have been preferrable to the "river view" we booked. The room was exactly like the pictures others posted however the room smelled just like air freshener from a gas station restroom. Unfortunately it was 90 degrees the 2 days we were there so couldn't open the window. The downtown location is good but hotel parking is limited due to the small lot so if the valet is busy its a long time to get in and out. The rate included a muffin, juice and coffee to the room for breakfast but our rate there was still too high as compared to the Marriott for example. Its tourist season and the inn was full so I guess they can overcharge for what you get and still get the customers. This hotel has downtown location but other than that the room just didn't feel updated and clean enough. I'm anxious to see what other travellers thought so I'll be following this site.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Serive & Bed”
Reviews.Author: Sterling40
Reviews.Content: First impression was...oh no look & listen to all the construction noise right next to our hotel. My husband and I were there for a special occasion and to get some peace and quite so we were somewhat sceptical at our first impression...but don't let this comment detour you from going! When checking in we were greated with warm smiles and a hello. We were told that we would not be able to get our room for 45 minutes...no problem ,we thought we'd go roam the little town and sample some wines.....but at the last moment the manager (I presume...or the person in charge at the time) looked at our reservation...noticed that we were there for a special occasion, and that I had requested to be placed in their quietest room. To our joy and surprise he said that we did not need to wait for our room, that he was upgrading us to one of their historic suites for free. Now that's what I call customer service and truley paying attention to what customers request when making their reservations and going above and beyond. Our room was very hisortic, lot's of personality and lot's of space. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in....you may never want to get out. With your reservation comes a free breakfast...don't pass this up..great food! The next morning we had been up at the crack of dawn to take a balloon ride and I had asked if they could pack our suggested breakfast to go (scone, danish and orang juice) which they did without hesitation. All in all our experience was the best...customer service was above & beyond...Oh yeah and the room they upgraded us to, wes great you could't even hear any of the construction going on. We were very impressed and very pleased. Great location to be able to park and walk all around town and wine taste. Lo't of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SLRoberts
Reviews.Content: Napa River Inn is a great place to stay in the Wine Country. We stayed in the Plaza Building on the second floor. Our King Bed room was spacious, well appointed, and decorated in a wine country motif. The bed was very comfortable and you can't beat the breakfast delivered right to your door from the bakery downstairs. Service was excellent. We ate at Celadon for dinner and both my husband and I were very pleased with the meal. The Inn is also walking distance to other restaurants. Staying at Napa River Inn was a relaxing and enjoyable experience and I would not hesitate to stay here again. Only one downside....downtown Napa is in the process of constructing a riverwalk and there was a lot of unsightly construction going on around the Inn. The construction was limited to daylight hours, so it did not interrupt our evening. However, our view of the river was ruined by concrete and rebar wall being erected to support the new riverwalk. Other than the fact that we really didn't get to enjoy the view from our balcony, this place was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: joeller
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experince. Close to everything. Staff great very helpful. Loved Sweetie pies got to have the scones! We check out this morning couldn't wait to write the review.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: WinegirlLa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Napa River Inn (and we stayed at a different hotel for two nights - we planned it that way!) PROS: We liked the location - walking distance to many downtown restaurants and beautiful neighborhood where we went running both mornings. The bed is very comfortable. Sweetie Pies breakfast is delicious and Celadon restaurant is a must! CONS: We felt it was a little overpriced for the room and service. After being very dissatisfied with our room, we were upgraded at no charge. The room was a little larger (not much) and had a fireplace, balcony and river view. Still, not that impressive considering the price and that it was an upgraded room! Not to mention, there was construction all along the river and it was not in good shape! Also, very thin walls made it a little noisy. I would probably stay here again because of the location and convenience, but the room was just average.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Rob_the_IT_Guy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Napa River Inn this past weekend, and it was absolutely wonderful. We had a Deluxe Room in the Historic Hatt Building. The room was magnificent. Very spacious, and decorated in heirloom-style furnishings. The canopy bed was huge, with a very comfortable mattress. There was also a nice sitting area with two comfortable chairs and a giant ottoman in front of a beautiful fireplace with the television mounted above. We really enjoyed sitting and relaxing after spending our days out exploring the spectacular Napa Valley. And the bathroom was awesome, with a slipper tub on one end and a two-person shower at the other end. This place was truly perfect for our relaxing romantic getaway. The hotel is just a short walk away from downtown Napa where you can find plenty of shops and places to eat. Not that you would need to go elsewhere to eat. Our complimentary breakfast was more than enough to get us going for the day. In fact the portions are more than we could eat. On Friday night, we enjoyed the free wine tasting in the hotel lobby. And the highly-rated Celadon Restaurant is located right onsite. It's a very easy drive to Highway 29, where you can drive for miles and miles and see all kinds of vineyards and wineries, or just enjoy the scenery. Our favorite was the Artesa Winery, which is actually a bit of a drive off the beaten path, but well worth the extra effort. We also enjoyed the Beringer Winery. We really didn't have time to do all the things we wanted to do on our weekend getaway. I guess we'll just have to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Ask more questions”
Reviews.Author: cjulie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Inn on a trip to the wine country. Never being there, I didn't know really where to stay. There were 3 couples that I was looking for and we chose to upgrade to both the 'river view' and the fireplace. The view was super dissapointing - that and our room was the first one you saw when you came upstairs, meaning we heard everyone come and go. I wasn't too happy considering my 'upgraded' room. Room 217 - room was okay, view was not worth the extra $$$. Bathroom was super small too. I will say the bed was great and the staff was pleasant. Our last day they did some cleaning and came to the window outside our room at 8:30am and started cleaning around the window with a broom. Luckily we were up!
