Breakfasts were really good - that was a plus. Overall - when going back to the wine country - I think I will choose to stay somewhere further up in wine country rather than downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “THE NAPA RIVER INN IS A WONDERFUL HOTEL - LARGE ROOMS, BATH, AND WONDERFUL BEDDI”
Reviews.Author: lscaldwell
Reviews.Content: Napa River Inn is a great hotel overlooking the Napa River. Large rooms, baths and wonderful bedding. Great hospitality and walking distance of lots of stores & restaurants. They bring you breakfast in the mornings! Great restaurant & bar on property. Stayed ther March 2007

Reviews.Title: “Charming Little Place”
Reviews.Author: havanahipster
Reviews.Content: I usually don't like to stay at historic hotels, but this seemed to be the best deal I could find. What a great little find--the hotel is located in a historic mill just a few blocks off downtown Napa. We stayed in the Plaza building, and the only donwside to it was our room overlooked the courtyard of the Celadon restaurant. On a more positive note, the room was nicely updated and the beds were very comfortable. Yummy Napa Valley Spa bath products, too. The front desk staff is extremely accommodating and will allow a late check out. All you have to do is ask nicely. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Spot in Napa Town”
Reviews.Author: Forestvillian
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night (wish it could have been much longer) at the very end of Feb. I had an American Express offer of an upgrade and we rec'd Rm. #231 on the 2nd floor of the River Plaza Bldg. It had been updated recently and was in perfect condition; spacious and done in earth colors with deep terracotta-colored wallpaper, traditional European-style furnishings (very nice, but not luxurious), extremely comfortable King bed, 2 large armchairs, "fainting couch", writing desk and chair, and widescreen flat panel TV above the gas fireplace (a very nice treat on a chilly day). The bathroom was also quite spacious and had a marble counter, marble walls and tub surround, a towel warmer, extra large showerhead, bath robes, a small refrig. and even a small safe. There was a nice selection of teas plus pretty standard coffee. The only complaint we had with the room was that there was no place for 2 people to sit to eat our ample breakfast. I know the Inn says it's "breakfast in bed" but it would have been nice to have a small table. During warmer weather we could have eaten out on our small balcony which looked directly out to the Napa River and had a bistro table and 2 chairs. From our balcony we could watch the Wine Train heading to and from the depot; saw ducks, geese, seagulls and an egret in the river, and were treated to gorgeous fluffy clouds overhead and a nearly full moon that night. Construction work is ongoing along the river and along Main St. and so the area between the Inn and the River was not nearly as scenic as it will be when construction of the flood protection wall and the paved riverwalkway with landscaping is completed (prob. sometime in 2009--it's a huge project). There is also temporary green fencing up along the construction area and it's not a pretty sight. For those visitors who wish to sleep in, our riverfront room would not have been a good choice as the heavy equipment with "beep, beep, beep" warning signals began a bit before 7:30 a.m. (we stayed on a Wed. night). For my husband and me, it wasn't a problem since we were up by then. It was actually pretty interesting to view the work in progress and we saw some parents with their kids who came down to watch the earthmovers in action. Back to our complimentary breakfast (from the on-premises bakery, Sweetie Pie): one is able to choose from a number of different items and categories. I had a bagel stuffed with fluffy egg and cheese, a wholegrain scone and fresh fruit. My husband had a croissant stuffed with egg and bacon, a Danish pastry and fresh orange juice. The portions were very large and both of us had something leftover. Along with choosing what to have, we were able to designate the time that we wanted the breakfast tray delivered to our room--and it arrived exactly on time. The front desk person and the person who delivered our breakfast tray and also worked in the lobby were friendly and very pleasant. We loved the entire historic Old Mill complex containing the 3 bldgs of the Napa River Inn, the restaurants Celadon, Angele and Napa General Store (we had meals and or wine at all 3 and were extremely pleased), excellent art gallery and a pretty lavendar products shop. It's a visually delightful place (the artistic mosaic fountain in the River Plaza is particularly fun). It was great to be able to leave our car in the lot (free parking, I might add) and take a nice, easy walk up Main St. to any number of great restaurants, wine bars and lounges. You'l see some interesting historic bldgs as you walk north. The acclaimed n.v. restaurant where we had dinner is only about 4-1/2 blocks from the Napa River Inn. We also passed Zuzu and Cole's Chop House. And yes, we found n.v. to be the perfect dining experience: ambience, service and superlative cuisine. I can't recommend a restaurant more highly. We will certainly be back to stay at the Napa River Inn as it provided us with a wonderful getaway where rest, relaxation and enjoyment of fine food and wine reigns supreme!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edelHouston
Reviews.Content: Read about the Napa River Inn on TripAdvisor and loved all the positive reviews - wow were they right! We were there for our Honeymoon for approx 5 nights. Upon check-in, we mentioned that we were on our honeymoon and was upgraded to a suite with a fireplace, overlooking the river. Breakfast in bed was definitely a highlight (you just fill out a form every night before 11pm selecting which danish, juice, etc you'd like, and what time you'd like it the next morning). The room itself was very cozy (a bit girly with all the flower motifs but my husband didn't mind!). The hotel is close to many fabulous restaraunts (within walking distance) and wine bars. Overall, fantastic place. Will stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: LSGJ
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of booking a block of rooms for my wedding at the Napa River Inn. The website boasted their service and amenities and so it looked promising and reasonable in price. When I arrived in Napa and there was a miunderstanding regarding the cancellation policy with my room block, I had to speak to the rooms division manager who was unforgiveably rude. He took no interest in servicing me or my guests and on top of that was extremely rude and condescending in tone and manner. When my husband and I travel, service and hospitality mean a lot to us on our trips and we were so disappointed with how we were treated that we would never consider staying at the Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good view, location and value!”
Reviews.Author: hoodoos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was the only place available in napa or sonoma that night. What a delightful surprise! It was romantic (our desire met) and affordable $197 AAA rate. We had fireplace, river view, patio access and great in (edge of) town location. Breakfast in room included and friendly staff. Main building is renovated historical, but we stayed in newer hotel bldg. We found it great value for that area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Great Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: TammyS
Reviews.Content: WOW!! What a great hotel. The most confortable bed ever and the staff was fantastic. The concierge made our dinner reservations for us and picked fantastic restaurants. The breakfast- unbelievable. Great location- you can walk through the cute town of Napa for wine tasting, shopping or dining. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: fensty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 days in Napa - it was the first trip to the area for both of us! We loved this hotel. I was a little concerned, based on some previous reviews I saw on this site, but I have nothing but good things to say. I should note that I am a VERY picky traveler and have very high expectations when I'm on vacation. We stayed in a superior room in the Plaza building with a balcony overlooking the river and a fireplace. The room was beautiful -- the view wasn't great, but if you want a great view, there are thousands of them all over the valley - at just about any winery you choose to visit. Overall, we paid an average of a little over $200 per night and I think that price was a good value. We did not have any problems with noise while we stayed - we actually thought it was fairly quiet. The bakery downstairs is wonderful - and breakfast is included in the room price. We ate dinner one evening at Angele, which was actually one of our best dinner experiences of the 5 nights we spent there (our waiter - Pablo - was excellent!). The staff at the hotel and the restaurants were wonderful and very helpful - with directions, recommendations, etc. If you plan on spending time in Napa and Sonoma counties, the locaion is great for that as well! We will definitely return to this hotel if our vacations plans ever bring us back to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa River Inn for 2 nights in April 2006. Our room was a Standard Room facing the street. The traffic was very noisy, and after complaining to the front desk, was informed we could move for a price, of course. The clerk said the traffic should "slow down" after the library closed. However, the noise was continuous. The room was small, but quaint. The breakfast from Sweetie Pie's was a nice touch. We would stay elsewhere when visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: cyngrant
Reviews.Content: My husband & I used Trip Advisor to help us select where to stay during our honeymoon in Napa. We saw mixed reviews on the Napa River Inn and have to say that this location is absolutely wonderful. It was so nice to stay where we had wonderful restaurants within walking distance. The continental breakfast is something that you won't believe. There was only one day where we were able to eat the whole thing & that was the day we only ordered for one. This hotel is quaint, the staff was wonderful & the location was great. We thoroughly enjoyed it and have recommended it to our friends. Well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant,peaceful and nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: denjules
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in Napa River Inn and thought that the hotel was really great. We had booked a superior room but as the room wasn't ready the desk clerk moved us to a historic delux room. The historic rooms are in the main building so the rooms are smaller and maybe a little darker and they have no balcony but they are absolutely beautfiul and have the most amazing bathrooms, infact the shower has two heads one at either end so two can shower at once and there is also a slipper tub. Add this to the large fireside chairs and the easy to use and not too overpowering fire and you have a very romantic room. Apart from the amount of natural light in the room I would say it was close to perfect. The hotel itself is harder to describe as it's quite small and spread around the historic mill but the service was good and they provided everything they descirbed on their website. The only downside was that the actual historic mill is really only made up of the hotel and eateries so if you're only there for one night and can only experience one evening meal then you feel like your missing out. Although you do get a brilliant breakfast sent to you room in the morning from Sweetie Pies which is amazing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a short romantic get away and being in Napa just adds to it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Great Food, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights prior to the Thanksgiving holiday and had a great stay. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel welcome - a great first impression. We dined outside at both Celadon and at the General Store and had great food and service at both places. The breakfasts were huge - excellent scones. We were on the top floor with a balcony overlooking the river and common area, where a new tiled fountain was being unveiled as we arrived. It was great to sit on the balcony each morning during the sunrise with our breakfast. Would not hesitate to return on a future trip to Napa - an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: annagrace
Reviews.Content: I took my husband for a surprise trip to Napa for his birthday. We stayed with friends two nights in Sacramento, and spent one night in Napa at the Napa River Inn. The inn is built in an old mill that has been renovated into a boutique hotel. The room was wonderful with wonderfully soft linens and an incredibly comfortable bed. Our room had a view of the Napa River (not very attractive) and a fireplace. It had a lovely marble bathroom with wine themed toiletries (!) which smelled pretty masculine. The hotel gives a free breakfast from a wonderful bakery downstairs. You can choose a variety of items and it is delivered to your room. The ham and egg croissant was delicious! The only problem is, be sure of the time that you want your breakfast. We woke up early since we're from Georgia (Eastern time) and tried to get breakfast early but it came as scheduled despite calling downstairs to get a rush on it. The hotel was minutes to the wineries and a wonderful, romantic getaway. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler79
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice two-night stay here. The staff was very friendly and helpful. For example, we rode the Wine Train one evening and the hotel arranged a free shuttle service both to and from the train so we could drink without having to worry about driving back. The rooms were very attractive and perhaps the best looking rooms that I have stayed in. I loved being able to choose from an assortment of delicious breakfast items and have it all delivered to the room in the morning. My only complaint is that the rooms are not as soundproof as they should be at a hotel of this class as you can clearly hear outside noise as well as noise from the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: VenturaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent time at the Napa River Inn! The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are clean. The breakfast from Sweetie Pies is a treat every morning! This is a great place to relax and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there for two nights mid October for 10th Aniversary. For a "boutique" hotel we thought it would be much nicer. Way overpriced for just a room overlooking a small river with industrial buildings on the other side. If you are looking for romantic, don't pick this hotel. Also, there is nothing going on in the town of Napa. We were so bored. Daytime you can drive and stop at vineyards, but there is no nightlife and nothing for shoping. We really wanted to head home after the first night. The breakfasts from Sweatie Pies were not worth eating. After 5 nights in CA, it was our only bad meal. Check out The Gables Wine Country Inn B&B in Santa Rosa (the private cottage was great!) and the Waters Edge in Tiburon (upgraded us to a suite on the water).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: Gioseppo
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little place. Everything is superb. Stay here you WILL NOT be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful little luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: smartshopper2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a Historic Suite. The hotel is beautiful, superbly decorated with elegant amenities, antiques, amazing clawfoot tub and double shower, comfy bed. Breakfast in bed was included. The breakfast was really the highlight of the stay - excellent fresh squeezed orange juice/coffee, choice of omlette on croissant or bagel, fruit parfait or quiche, danish, scone or bun - all made by the wonderful Sweetie Pie Bakery on the first floor (you can smell the fresh pastries baking around 5 AM). Staff was reasonably nice but didn't seem to be terribly knowledgable about Napa. (I found this kinda odd). The hotel is in downtown Napa, so there was a bit more street noise than I had hoped. The river is at the back of the hotel, next to the freeway. The front of the hotel is close to the Napa Courthouse and their restaurant/shopping area. Overall it was very restful and pleasant. Got a great deal on it, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, great price”
Reviews.Author: SortaFussy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location right in downtown Napa, close to everything you need. Rooms are nicely appointed with super-comfy beds, nice decor and a spiffy bathroom. We had a double queen room for our family of four and were in the building behind the Celadon restaurant on the river. The price is right and comes with a full breakfast to order from the nice bakery downstairs. Definitely a good deal and very clean. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Lucky us!”
Reviews.Author: mkd
Reviews.Content: We are three couples just back from 10 days in northern California, three nights of which were spent at the NRI. When we arrived there was a little confusion because I thought I booked three executive rooms with king sized beds. My husband and I received a double bedded room instead but the staff said they would check to see if another room was available. Well, lucky us, we were upgraded to the Captain Hatt suite, featured on their website. This was an unexpected treat! Needless to say, our room was the spacious center of our daily wine and cheese pre-dinner gathering. Kudos to the NRI for really going out of their way to correct a minor glitch. As to food, the dinners we had at Celadon was some of the best of our trip, the scones from Sweetie Pies were amazing and our Celadon waitress's recommendation to try Uva, a trattoria a few blocks away, was spot on. I agree with an earlier post that Napa is a great location to serve as a base for wine country travels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, delicious breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa River Inn with our small family in July on a visit to Napa. The hotel is beautifully done and very well furnished. We stayed in a room with two double beds and there was plenty of room for the four of us. The rooms were quiet and the beds were comfortable. they even provided a CD for bedtime music. The generous breakfast is delivered to your door from Sweetie Pie's bakery downstairs. Get the morning buns. They are to die for. We were a little skeptical about the location when we arrived ( it is across the street from the county jail), but we felt safe and secure at all times. You have to use your room key to access the buildings. There are several very good restaurants on property and more within walking distance. The staff was courteous and helpful. We highly recommend the Napa River Inn to anyone headed to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Dogs barking....at a Luxury Boutique Hotel??? Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to stay at this hotel since it sounded so quaint and interesting! However, our first night we were woken up at 2:00 a.m. because of a dog barking in the room next to us. The very next morning, that guest left, however the guest in the room across from us also had a dog, and it barked for three hours straight while the guests were out. We did report this to the front desk, and they offered an apology but said, "I'm sorry, we are a pet friendly hotel." We can envision Motel 6 being pet friendly, but not a hotel in which we spent almost $300.00 per night (we love pets, by the way, just not barking dogs all around us in a hotel) The noise from the city traffic across the river is loud in the morning, and if you are on the first or second floors it sounds as if there are elephants on top of you from people moving around. That said, we really enjoyed Celedon, and the morning breakfast from Sweetie Pies was great!! In our opinion, this hotel is overpriced for the amenities offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Once They Worked Out Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in Napa, and we were celebrating our ninth anniversary with a two night stay. When we arrived, they gave us room 111 in the Embarcadero building with a "view" of the river. The room was small, but nice, and they left us a bottle of wine that I am assuming was for our anniversary, which I thought was sweet. We left our room to walk into town, and upon our return to our room that evening, we discovered a very loud humming sound. Upon my investigation, I found out that they put us in the room that backed up to the electrical supply room! Now, I am not a nitpicky person, but we were there for a special occasion and I knew that it would be impossible to sleep. Plus, at $260 per night, I decided that we shouldn't have to put up with the noise. I called the front desk, and they said that they would call us back with another room that was available. It was about half an hour before they called us back, which frustrated us a bit because it was quite late and we were tired after a full day of wine tasting! After I called the front desk back when I ran out of patience, the clerk said that the phone must have been broken also, because she had been trying to call us. Anyway, they sent a bellboy over to collect our things, and we were moved into the main building, room 233. Now this was more like it! I was told that this room was their most recently renovated room, and it had a view of the river (not too much to look at, but a nice gesture), a balcony, a plasma tv, fireplace, and marble bathroom. The robes in the room and the towel warmer were very nice amenities. The only thing that was odd was that the mini fridge and safe were in the bathroom, and they placed them where there was no electrical access, so the fridge was mildewed and we couldn't use the safe. We figured that maybe with their recent renovation it was probably somehing they overlooked, so we didn't think much of it. A nice touch was the breakfast that was included from Sweetie Pies. It was very good, and more than what you would expect for a free breakfast. From what I had heard around town, Sweetie Pies is the best bakery in Napa. All in all, we probably would stay here again if we could get one of the newer rooms, so I would definitely make sure that you request one. The inn is centrally located to downtown, so you can walk to several places, and it is considered a historical hotel which was neat. I hope this review helps you a bit!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After searching for several weeks for somewhere to stay for our one-night trip to Napa, we settled on the Napa River Inn. Boy were we surprised! The beds were so comfortable, the rooms had character, bathrobes hanging in the gorgeous marble-tiled bathrooms, and the most amazing complimentary breakfast I've ever had. Just to give you a feel: The breakfast was catered by Sweetie Pies, a local bakery/coffee shop downstairs (which has also received some good reviews on this site). The breakfast included a choice of juices, a choice of bagel or croissant sandwiches, and a choice of scones/rolls/danishes. Each person in the room got to make their own selections, and the breakfast was promptly delivered at whatever time you select. I had never seen anything like it. Absolutely amazing. Such a nice way to end our stay in Napa. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was right along the river. All the restaurants were within walking distance to the hotel. All around, this was a great experience. I highly recommend it and plan on staying there again the next time I'm in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting history, fabulous service and location! NO GHOSTS!”
Reviews.Author: JetSet1
Reviews.Content: This is a detailed review for those who believe more is better. My husband and I had a short 3 day weekend getaway to Napa. The service was wonderful throughout! After our bellman asked and we told him we were celebrating our anniversary, he came back to give us two champagne flutes, a bottle of sparkling wine and a box of decadent truffles. Napa River Inn staff are among the best I've seen. The location of the inn being very close to the highway, the COPIA which is a must-see in Napa, the Wine Train and one block away from the free downtown trolley (which includes a stop at Copia) is a major plus. I'd say the only downside is that the views aren't spectacular from any angle. I wasn't sure what to expect with the photos showing a grain silo-type structure in the middle of the inn. The room itself was clean and nicely decorated with tasteful art depicting Napa vineyards. We had turn down service and chocolate mints on our pillows waiting for us each night. The bathroom walls and floors looked like marble and the sink was actually marble top. The history of the mill adds a lot to the Napa River Inn. Yes, they used to store feed in the buildings a long, long time ago, but the government also used it to store wines and other alcoholic drinks. There are lots of photos, plaques, memorials, and memorabilia on the grounds that explain the interesting history. It's a pet-friendly inn and I saw several guests had their little well-groomed toy dogs with them, the concierge looked like she was informally doggie-sitting when I checked in. I'm allergic and thought that might be a problem but it was not. However, I was sneezing each time I visited a winery, so was glad I brought the antihistamines along. I was worried when our toilet backed up as soon as we arrived but when we called maintenance, they arrived very promptly, fixed it and it was never a problem again! For an extremely quiet and peaceful getaway I would stay elsewhere but for the fairly quiet but centrally located inn with various amenities located nearby, I would definitely recommend the Napa River Inn. The Greenhaus European Spa is across the parking lot and is small but has some good massage therapists and estheticians use Decleor-the best facial product around! The inn is on the same lot as two very popular and bustling restaurants: Angele and Celadon. People will come from other parts of town to dine at these restaurants-and they will crowd the parking lots at night. There is also an art gallery which doubled as a small jazz/blues dance club ($7 cover) on Friday night, a spa supply store and a General Store which sold snacks and unique gift items--however the service of those running the General store (I don't think it's managed by the Inn) was horrendous! There is also a new candy shop on the grounds which has lots of chocolates, etc. to choose from. Many restaurants, wine bars and hangouts are within blocks and Zuzus is one block away for good tapas and sangria. We were willing to do some driving to take in a couple of wineries. Our best find for dining was Rutherford Grille in Rutherford--fantastic! REcommended by the fantastic winery and deli next door (V Sattui). Also, I'd recommend Bistro Jeanty in Yountville for a relaxed and unpretentious but spectacular French menu. Domaine Chandon is a must. And Julia's Kitchen at Copia was great! At the Napa River Inn, we stayed in one of the "superior" room with a terrace facing Southeast, a fireplace we didn't use and a river view. There was NO construction going on at all while we were there but the riverbank did look muddy and unattractive. I was surprised there was no greenery other than a few wildflowers across the river; however that is not Napa River Inn's property. I heard and saw a few ducks and geese along the river right outside our terrace and saw the sunrise over the hills and trees in the far distance but there is also a view of a major street and car lot in the distance too--I could barely hear the cars at night but it was still audible. The room itself was neither large nor small. Free bottled Calistoga water in the fridge and Fiji bottled water on the table for $4.50 a bottle. The breakfast in bed which was included with our room rate was superb! We had to choose from danish, bun or scone AND egg/ham or egg/bacon or just egg sandwich on bagel or croissant OR granola and yogurt OR something else AND a choice of juices or tea or coffee. First morning I ordered the scone and the egg/ham bagel sandwich with regular (free) coffee. Second morning, the same but for an extra $4 I ordered a delicious 16 oz. mocha coffee. All of it was piping hot when delivered--you tell them the night before what 30 minute time slot you want it delivered. One morning I changed my mind and wanted it earlier and they gladly obliged by bringing it within 10 minutes. All the breakfast is made at Sweetie Pies which is a delightful bakery that has a large selection of beautifully made gourmet pastries, cakes, cookies, berry crumbles, you name it-they have it all! Hope this helps--be sure you know which direction your room will be facing. I would have hated a room in the plaza building that faces the lobby building and the restaurant outdoor seating area. Basically your window would face another building. But a room with river view although not a breathtaking view will likely be much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by details”
Reviews.Author: WendyDemy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one-night stay at the Napa River Inn. We were so excited to be going there because of all the wonderful reviews. Previous to arriving at the Inn, I was informed the type of room I requested would not be available. Because my friend and I (two middle-aged women) wanted separate beds, we were not able to get the balcony or river view we would have preferred. Instead, we had a fireplace (too hot in May) overlooking the parking lot. The room was very pleasant but small, as was the bathroom. We were looking forward to the breakfast in bed from Sweetie Pie's, which is actually just a tray plunked down on the bed. One of us chose the AM Bun, which was certainly nothing special. My friend chose the Danish, which was downright inedible - hard and dry. My quiche was delicious as was her egg croissant. Coffee is made yourself in your room, which I've done many times in other hotels. However, this was the weirdest tasting coffee! We added the cream supplied in our mini-fridge and sugar substitute, as this is the way we usually have our coffee, but could not stand the strange flavor. One more thing that was most unusual for a nice hotel was the lack of water pressure in the shower - practically nonexistent. All in all, I'd have to say that this hotel is way overpriced for what you get although I understand that in the wine country everything's pretty pricey. I would not stay at the Napa River Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Ghosts?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our good friends stayed one night at the Napa River Inn.. The room was great! The breakfast was great! Had a wonderful meal in town and wine tasting at the Bounty Hunter. I was surprised to find out that Napa closes up at 6:00p! We retired very ealry and that is when we had a slight problem. Someone in the room above us paced all night long! The interesting part of this review came after our return home. It appears the hotel is haunted (I am not one to believe in ghosts), however it does make me wonder. We will return to the Napa River Inn ghosts and all!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: GJP1
Reviews.Content: In dire need of a weekend getaway, we decided a stay at the Napa River Inn would be ideal. We certainly were not disappointed. The room was small but beautifully appointed. We dined at Celadon the first night and the food was good, though somewhat pricey. The breakfast at Sweetie Pie's left us spinning. The following night we decided on tapas at Zuzu's down the street. The food was fabulous and the wait staff pleasant and attentive. There is terrific shopping just a few blocks away on First Street. An overall delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say. Room was clean and ready when we got there. Hotel staff was very friendly. Breakfast was great. Nice location. Had a wine tasting in the lobby which was a nice bonus. After reading some of the reviews, I was expecting to find a 2 foot wide, "industrial" creek instead of a river next to the hotel .... but, I was surprised to find a good sized, very nice river right behind the hotel. I thought it looked nice. I'm not sure what people expected, but what we found was a nice, quiet, well-kept hotel. I'd definitely stay at the Napa River Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: ginnybear
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews, but I thought the Napa River Inn was a great value. Everything was close by-great restaurants, Napa Opera House, deli, great wine bar, Napa Wine train. The room was clean and spacious and the staff was friendly and professional. I think it's a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: christine888
Reviews.Content: I just visited Napa with my parents and stayed at the Inn for 3 nights. We had a positive experience. The hotel gave us all of our requests except the "River View" room, but it was all right because the sight wasn't that scenic, but is of more industrial view. One thing to warn you is that the hotel is in a restored historial building, so there is no soundproof to speak of, our room is right next to a public parking lot and neighborhood streets, and the road next the river was under re-construction that produced noise loud and clear. When I called the front desk, he explained to me that the city doesn't notify the hotel for such work. The good thing is, if you are patient, the work would stop no later than 10 PM, which is the city policy. The hotel rooms are spread out between 3 buildings, with shops and 2 resturants on site, so when the Mill is occupied by many visitors, the parking would seem scarce. The "complimentary" breakfast was provided by the on-site Sweetie Pie Bakery (separately owned, but in the same restored Mill location). The food are generous in size and rich in flavor. The morning room delivery service at your chose time is a gracious gesture offered by the hotel, but I highly recommend taking a few steps to walk to the bakery to enjoy fresh egg/cheese sandwich, one of the offerings, for example. I've seen a few breakfast baskets waiting for a while for the only hotel staff to deliver them. The warm sandwich would be cold by then. The bakery is not big, but you have the choice of seating indoor or outdoor. I don't recommend ordering the "fruit plate" as they were pre-prepared and refrigerated so some of the fruits didn't tasty as fresh. The bakery makes tasty treats, so you get to see locals coming in the door as well. Convenient location: The hotel offers 2 quality restaurants and is in walking distance to some of the town's other excellent eateries. It's 5 minutes drive to the Wine Train and 6 minutes to Copia (where twice a week has Farmer's Market, but I wasn't impressed). It's 9 Miles south of the quaint town of Yountville, where the famed French Laundary restaurant is. It's at the south tip (beginning) of the Napa Valley. 1 hour drive north of Berkeley without traffic. Wish you a pleasant stay as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Visit, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JSullivanG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel as we wanted to attend a performance at the nearby Napa Valley Opera House. Hotel's location was ideal. Staff helpful with offering hotel shuttle to get us to a restaurant on outskirts of town--particularly helpful since I was hobbling around in a cast from a broken ankle. Wine tasting at Bounty Hunter several blocks away was a nice touch. We went back a second night. Hotel itself is a well designed renovation of an old mill and warehouse. Renovations appear to be ongoing and there was construction noise. Also noise from the construction on the 3rd Street/Avenue? bridge over the river. That isn't the hotel's fault, but if you want to sleep in I suggest asking for a room away from the construction. Although promised a room that looked out on a garden, ours (in the historic section) actually looked out on an unimproved lot across the street. Room was lovely with king bed, nice partial canopy and wonderful appointments and amenities in the bathroom. However, price even with AAA discount was $315. for a weeknight--well above the range listed on Trip Advisor. The Sweeties Pies bakery deserves all the kudos it has received in other reviews, but our second day the hotel didn't have enough people to get all the breakfast baskets delivered in a timely way. My husband finally went down to the bakery and picked ours up. Not a big deal, but not breakfast in bed, either. Historic section of the hotel was nice because there weren't very many rooms and there was a wonderful sitting room adjacent to the elevator where one could sit and relax. We had no problem with noise between rooms as has been mentioned. The restaurant Celedon, one of two full-service restaurants in the complex, had outstanding food which was well-priced, I thought. One nice touch--large plate and small plate entrees and no hassle about how one ordered. There is both inside and semi-covered courtyard seating. My husband preferred inside, which is what we did, but next time--the courtyard for sure. One thing about the river--it looks more like a canal. I wouldn't worry if you can't get a room with a view. I would certainly stay at this hotel again, and my husband loved it--particularly the historic feel--but I might try to see if I couldn't get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've been the the Napa Valley many times and found this to be our favorite hotel in either Napa or Sonoma so far. They are new, so they try harder. The staff is just wonderful- friendly, helpful, with lots of great suggesstions on where to go and what to do. Actually, they are not far away from the wineries at all. We usually don't like to visit the tourist-ridden wineries along highway 29 anyway, and prefer the smaller production, high quality wines in the Carneros district and along Silverado Trail. We were also given free tastings at the Bounty Hunter and Vintner's collective, right down the street! The rooms are wonderully appointed- they obviously spent a lot of money on the furnishings, and included in the room was breakfast, coffee, spa products, and free delivery. No other hotel we have ever stayed in has given us so much. We will definately be back in the fall!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a treat! The rooms were nicely furnished. Very cozy with all amenities of a luxury stay. Best of all everything is brand new. Great smelling soaps and shampoos. Not pricey at all considering that the B&B runs at least $150 and isn't as new.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the napa river inn!!”
Reviews.Author: Alison7777
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful - we had a gas fireplace that was so cozy. Large bathrooms. The bell hop was so nice and helped us find a restaurant for that evening, made our reservations. We ate at Celodon in the same building and it was so tasty. We received a free breakfast at our choice of two places (or could have had it brought into our room at whatever time we desired). We chose the napa general store and it was some of the best food that I have had. Overall this was a great experience. Only drawback is that they talk about a 'river view' - we had construction on the other side of the river from our room, and it didn't look that pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Overpriced, but I Wasn't Paying!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Napa River Inn in January 2003. My best friend took me for an extended birthday weekend and we had a wonderful time. I agree with everyone else that Sweetie Pies is wonderful - you get more food than you can eat for a week for breakfast and it is all very tasty! The staff is very nice and helpful and they were thoughtful enough to present a complimentary bottle of wine for my birthday. There's a general store that is very handy and the hotel provides a complimentary wine tasting there. The room was actually better than expected; sometimes with older hotels you aren't sure whether you will come to a place where renovations are in order, but I found the room to be very comfortable and clean (and I'm very picky having stayed at way too many dingy places traveling for work). We were within walking distance to several restaurants and we enjoyed walking through the town. We also enjoyed treatments at the spa on the property and we had no complaints there (only advice - don't go to the spa after a day of wine tasting - you'll fall asleep and miss the pampering)! As much as I enjoyed the weekend at Napa River Inn, for my next trip I might try staying in Yountville where we discovered there was a lot more to do within walking distance. Staying in the old part of town was great to do once, but for repeat trips I don't think I'll do it again. You have to do it once, though, and Napa River Inn is the best bet for the quaint old town experience. I would say it is worth paying a little more for the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with some down sides”
Reviews.Author: Jczoo
Reviews.Content: Read this review bearing in mind that I have stayed at the Ritz in Half Moon Bay. The Napa River in is very nice but the town of Napa its self is still in the process of renovation. The rooms are very pleasant but not quite what I would call luxury. Don't opt for the view because there is construction going on across the river which is very noisy and quite ugly to look at. Sweetie Pies breakfast was very good and there are two nice restaurants right on the property. If I were to do this short trip (2 nights) again I would probably stay in Sonoma County where it is still a little more quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Napa River Inn was great”
Reviews.Author: cabanna59
Reviews.Content: Property was everything we had hoped. Rooms, restaurants, people were all wonderful. Great location. Tip on another restaurant in the area...loved Bistro Don Giovanni.

Reviews.Title: “Sweetie Pies Breakfasts to die for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while visiting Napa in 2002. It was very relaxing. Our room had a fire place and the service was super. It was a very cozy place. The best thing we loved about it were the delicious breakfasts which were free at Sweetie Pies located at the inn premises. It was a truly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mcavStCharles_Mo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a one night stay at the Inn. Although a nice place it is overpriced for what you get. The rooms are nice but pretty small and the bathrooms are very small. The staff was friendly, especially the gentlemen who offered to take us and pick us up from the wine train. The free breakfast at Sweetie Pies was very good...come w/ an empty stomach. I do not have any complaints w/ the inn except for the price and what you get for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Napa River Inn - Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: timjax9
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - paid for a standard room but was upgraded to a riverview room on arrival. Nice complex on the river with a renovated mill building that was turned into a general store, breakfast cafe, and two nice restaurants. Good location too in heart of Napa which is the perfect spot to head up to Napa valley or over to Sonoma. Place looks much nicer than pictures on the website - always a nice surprise which rarely seems to happen.
